p: These evaluation studies present a mixed picture in terms of the effectiveness of biosecurity engagement campaigns aimed at raising awareness and encouraging new behaviours among recreationists. Importantly, simply being exposed to information about a biosecurity issue did not translate into large numbers of people gaining new knowledge and changing behaviours [ 24, 29]. Familiarity with outreach campaign logos has generally been found to be low, with recreationists often not understanding slogans [ 25, 27].
